[{'question': 'How much funds does Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Limited plan to raise, and through what means?',
  'answer': 'Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Limited (APSEZ) plans to raise up to Rs 5000 crore through a public issuance of non-convertible debentures. Each debenture will have a face value of Rs. 1000, and the issuance may occur in one or more tranches.',
  'context': 'According to a stock exchange filing on January 3rd, Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Limited (APSEZ) has received board approval to raise up to Rs 5000 crore. This decision highlights the company’s proactive approach to securing funds for potential growth opportunities.'},
 {'question': 'What is the significance of Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone’s cargo volume target for FY 2023-24?',
  'answer': "Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Limited is aiming to handle over 400 metric tonnes (MMT) of cargo volume in FY 2023-24.  {'question': 'How did Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Limited’s cargo volume perform in December 2023?',
  'answer': 'Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Limited reported a 42% year-on-year (YoY) increase in cargo volumes, reaching 35.65 MMT in December 2023. This substantial growth highlights the company’s robust operational performance and ability to attract higher cargo traffic.',
  'context': 'Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Limited shared positive news in December 2023, reporting a significant 42% year-on-year (YoY) jump in cargo volumes.  {'question': 'What is the latest update on the legal matters involving Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Limited and the Hindenburg issue?',
  'answer': 'The Supreme Court of India, on January 3, 2024, made a significant decision regarding the petitions related to the Hindenburg issue and Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Limited. This decision arrived a month after the court had reserved its judgment on the allegations of stock price manipulation by the Adani Group.',
  'context': 'In a significant legal development, the Supreme Court of India addressed the petitions concerning the Hindenburg issue and Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Limited on January 3, 2024. The court decided to dispose of the petitions seeking an investigation by either a Special Investigation Team (SIT) or the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI). This decision came after a month-long period following the court’s reservation of its judgment on the allegations of stock price manipulation involving the Adani Group in November.'},
